title: 1050 Lebanon Road and 1107 Lebanon Road Sawmill Historic Research

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request metadata relating to emails sent with the following text strings anywhere in the body or subject line, partial or complete:

1 - "1050 Lebanon Rd"
2 - "1050 Lebanon Road" or "1050 Lebanon Rd" or "1050 Lebanon Way"
3 - "ILC"
4 - "Industrial Log" or "Independent Log"
5 - Parcel Number 5611-233-00-003
6 - any discussion regarding Legal Summary Section: 23 Township: 36 Range: 16 TR IN W/2SW/4SW1/4; 9.64AC B226 P164 B406 P35
7 - containing text "Tony Moore" or "Anthony Moore"
8 - containing text "Mary Lancaster"
9 - "1107 Lebanon Road" or "1107 Lebanon Rd" or "1107 Lebanon Way"
10- Parcel Number 5611-224-00-034
11- "drive-in" or "drive in" or "old drive in"
12- containing text "sawmill" or "sawmill on Lebanon" 
13-containing text "LIVELY LOGGING"
14- containing text "Paula Lively" or "Jeff Lively"

Include any correspondence from within City of Cortez where the email address which is inbound or outbound or cc'd: or any other emails.

Please aggregate by the five categories and provide me the following information for all emails sent or cc'd into the City's emails from Jan. 1 2002 to the present to/from/cc/bcc the above-listed accounts to include:

1. From address
2. To address
3. bcc addresses
4. cc addresses
5. Time
6. Date
7. Subject


Please note that I am not requesting the contents of each email. This is lessen the burden as expressed by your city attorney, and to expedite the request. 

I am more than happy to provide documentation or tips for extracting this information from your mail server if needed. Google's Vault tooling should make this request straightforward to complete. E-mail metadata is trivially exportable from the IT infrastructure of any modern e-mail archiving or data retention system - such as Microsoft Outlook 365, Google, Datacove, etc. - and should be deliverable in a .CSV, .XLS, or other machine readable format. PDF is not preferred, and seems to have issues displaying the entire fields.

Please note that I am not requesting the contents of each email. E-mail metadata does not include the contents of the specified e-mails, thus do not need individual review for redaction.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. If possible, I would request a waiver of all fees for searching or copying these records in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding.

1. When filing this, please note which documents have already been paid for by another FOIA request, and I request that if those documents have already been screened, that they not be duplicated in cost.
2. Since this is an electronic request, the print version should not be provided, but for purposes of cost estimation, please take into consideration that Cortez population is underprivileged, and extend the courtesy of pricing accordingly.
2a. The economic information for this judgment comes from the submission done by myself of Kauffman Indicators of Entrepreneurship for Montezuma County in comparison to many surrounding counties in Utah, New Mexico, and Colorado. As seen in page 8 of the enclosed and publicly presented documents August 22, 2023, Montezuma County has compensation ranking at 39.27% within the Kaufmann Entrepreneurial Jobs Indicators, meaning that the policy taken by Cortez brings it into direct conflict with the interests of the people they impact should they price these or other electronic documents at a punitive rate.
2b. Because these documents are of the public interest, and the population is demonstrably disadvantaged, the policies of Cortez which require hundreds or thousands of dollars to achieve transparency could be construed poorly in civil proceedings, meaning that legal fees could ensue which would further penalize City of Cortez budgets. This is not my intent, therefore I state it up front that the best course of action would be to ensure that FOIA costs are not borne as specified.
3. Staff time to review these documents should reflect the actual costs, not the maximum costs allowed by CORA law, please recalculate these costs taking into consideration both the public interest as well as eliminating from your cost estimate any documents previously screened by staff.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely, 

Charles Jeter
---------

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Charles Jeter

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Hialeah Police Department Request
communications.communication:
To Whom it may concern,
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:
Any and all records from the past year regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as ordinance in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as Code of Ordinances, Code enforcement, Administrative Abatement of Drug or Prostitution Related Nuisances as described in Part II, Chapter 22, Article IV of the city code.
Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to:
• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request.
Sincerely,
Jenny Wadhwa

communications.subject: Your City of Hialeah, FL public records request #24-4560 has been opened.
communications.communication:
City of Hialeah, FL ************************************************************************ Your record request #24-4560 has been submitted successfully. Thank you for contacting the City of Hialeah. We are in receipt of your public records request. You may use the following two links to access the City’s policy on public records: https://www.hialeahfl.gov/DocumentCenter/View/612/Ordinance-2013-85-PDF https://www.hialeahfl.gov/DocumentCenter/View/182/Ordinance-2018-026-PDF These provisions are consistent with Florida law, and we hope you will find them informative as we fulfill your request. Please be advised that processing your public records request may require extensive use of information technology resources, and/or extensive clerical or supervisory assistance. The City has determined that any request that requires more than fifteen minutes to locate, gather, review, redact, copy or make records available for inspection is an extensive request. These services will be charged at the hourly rate of the least paid employee capable of performing the task according to the City’s policy. You may use the following link to access the City’s ordinance, codified at Section 2-871 in the City of Hialeah Code of Ordinances, which describes the costs of duplication and certification of public documents: https://library.municode.com/fl/hialeah/codes/code_of_ordinances?nodeId=PTIICOOR_CH2AD_ARTVFI_DIV2FECH_S2-871DUCEPUDO . The law requires that we respond to your request within a reasonable time. Reasonable time includes the time necessary to search for records, review and redact the records for exempt or confidential material, as well as copy the records or make them available for inspection. At this time, we will forward your request to the appropriate department(s) in the City to determine whether any records within the department are responsive to your request. Once we have had an opportunity to conduct an internal search, we will prepare a cost estimate for time and resources necessary to provide you with your records, if any, as provided by the City’s policy. Thank you. The due date for your request may be later than usual because the office is closed on: * May 27: Memorial Day As the requester, you can always see the status of your request by signing into the City of Hialeah, FL portal. If you haven't already signed in, you may need to activate or setup your account to get started. Once your account is activated, you can communicate directly with the City of Hialeah, FL through NextRequest. ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact City of Hialeah, FL.

Change your email settings | Visit our help center

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Public Records Request: GoGuardian
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

CONTRACTS and AGREEMENTS
• All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents with CDW LCC for the use of GoGuardian that were active any time between 1/1/2018 and 5/23/2024.

TERMS OF SERVICE
• All terms of service agreement documents with CDW LCC for the use of GoGuardian or with GoGuardian that were active any time between 1/1/2018 and 5/23/2024.

FINANCIAL MATERIALS
• All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to GoGuardian or Liminex. Responsive materials include all invoices, bills, receipts, check stubs, or any other records, including those possessed in an electronic format. Responsive materials include any records related to the funding of GoGuardian or Liminex-related technologies, partnerships, and subscriptions, including those related to civil asset forfeiture funds, grants, and any other funding sources.

MARKETING and PROMOTION MATERIALS
• All promotional, descriptive, and marketing materials in the possession of this agency related to and/or referencing “GoGuardian" or "Liminex" and any of its products and services. This includes all presentations, marketing materials, technical documentation, proposals, or similar records shared with this agency and/or any representative thereof by CDW, GoGuardian, or Liminex and any representative thereof.

GUIDING DOCUMENTATION and POLICIES
• All policies, memorandums of understanding, and other guidance materials generated by this agency and/or entity operating on its behalf regarding the acquisition and use of any data or services provided by CDW, GoGuardian or Liminex and any representative thereof or any subdivision thereof. Responsive materials include, but are not limited to, any data-sharing agreements, terms of use, licensing agreements, data retention policies, and any other guiding materials, such as user manuals, other guidance materials, help documents, or related materials.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: Minnesota Government Data Practices Act Request: Pickleball (Minneapolis Parks Police)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all written or electronic communications, including attachments, between your department and members of USA Pickleball, (@usapickleball.org). This request seeks documents created between January 1, 2020 and the date this request is processed.

- Any emailed or formal complaints containing the word "pickleball." Please search between January 1 and the time this request is processed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Jason Koebler

communications.communication:
Dear Requestor –

Please see email below that was sent to you on Friday, August 25th. The emails are in queue to be reviewed.  You will be notified when the review is complete.

Dear Requestor,

Your data request is partially complete. Please be advised that the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act requires that the Minneapolis Park and Recreation Board provide to persons who make requests for data all public data responsive to the request but does not require the Minneapolis Park and Recreation Board to create responsive data that does not already exist.


Responsive data attached.


Data Requested

- Any and all written or electronic communications, including attachments, between your department and members of USA Pickleball, (@usapickleball.org). This request seeks documents created between January 1, 2020 and the date this request is processed.   This data has been attached.

- Any emailed or formal complaints containing the word "pickleball." Please search between January 1 and the time this request is processed. There are approx. 3300 emails, attachments, etc…to review.  At this point, due to the amount of data, this review will take weeks to months.  Once responsive public data is available it will be placed on a flash drive.  You will be notified when the data is complete.  An invoice will be prepared and sent along with the email, as well as payment instructions.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Data Requests

communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: IReady usage time data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1) For each grade level (or classroom, if not available at grade level), data showing the amount of time students spent on lessons in the IReady system for the year to date. This data can be accessed through the IReady system's lesson time-on-task feature. An example of the lesson time-on-task report from another district can be seen here: https://www.detroitk12.org/cms/lib/MI50000060/Centricity/Domain/5951/IREADY%20Reading%20Time%20of%20Task%20022822.pdf

2) For each grade level (or classroom, if not available at grade level), data showing the amount of time students spent playing learning games in the IReady system for the year to date. This data can be accessed through the IReady system's "Playtime" report. A guide to accessing the Playtime report can be found here (page 15): https://resources.finalsite.net/images/v1701973094/myvolusiaschoolsorg/xjqbs2fxosdtve0tlhi3/iready-educator-guide-learning-games-2-1.pdf 

Please note: I am not requesting data for individual students, but rather aggregate and/or average data at the grade or classroom level.

If you have any questions about this request, including questions about the timeframe or scope of the data, please don't hesitate to ask. I'm happy to set up a time to discuss this request over the phone.

I ask that all fees be waived as I am a journalist and intend to used the requested records to publish articles in the public interest and not for any commercial purpose.

If you choose to impose fees, I request a detailed breakdown of the fees, including the hourly wage of each employee involved and an explanation of the employee hours required to fulfill the request.

If you choose to reject this request or redact portions of responsive documents, I ask that you provide a detailed breakdown of the statutory exemptions and associated case law underlying your decision to withhold each/any portions from public review.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Todd Feathers

communications.subject: Re: Oregon Public Records Law Request: IReady usage time data (PRR 2324-274)
communications.communication:
Hello:


This email acknowledges your public records request of 3/18/2024, which has
been assigned the tracking number PRR 2324-274. We understand you are
seeking the following public records:


1) For each grade level (or classroom, if not available at grade level),
data showing the amount of time students spent on lessons in the IReady
system for the year to date.
- This data can be accessed through the IReady system's lesson time-on-task
feature. An example of the lesson time-on-task report from another district
can be seen here:
https://www.detroitk12.org/cms/lib/MI50000060/Centricity/Domain/5951/IREADY%20Reading%20Time%20of%20Task%20022822.pdf
2) For each grade level (or classroom, if not available at grade level),
data showing the amount of time students spent playing learning games in
the IReady system for the year to date.
- This data can be accessed through the IReady system's "Playtime" report.
A guide to accessing the Playtime report can be found here (page 15):
https://resources.finalsite.net/images/v1701973094/myvolusiaschoolsorg/xjqbs2fxosdtve0tlhi3/iready-educator-guide-learning-games-2-1.pdf


*Please let us know if this does not accurately describe the records you
are looking for.*


*Before we can proceed*, we have some clarifying questions about your
request. Specifically, are you looking for this information for a specific
school or schools, or are you seeking aggregate data for all PPS schools?


Once we receive this clarification, we can proceed with a search for
responsive records.


If it is necessary to charge fees to fulfill this request, we will provide
a written cost estimate detailing the work to be performed and approximate
volume/nature of the records to be provided.


We note that you have requested a fee waiver. We will wait to make a
decision on waiving or reducing fees until after they have been assessed.


We try to respond to all requests within fifteen business days. Please note
some requests are complex or involve such a large volume of records that
additional time may be needed. If that is the case, we will provide our
best estimated date for completion.


If you have any questions or concerns about the public records process, we
encourage you to contact our office. It is always our goal to provide
records in a timely manner without undue delay or expense.






*Thank you kindly,*

Ryan Vandehey

Public Records Officer & Media Relations Representative

Portland Public Schools
Communications Department | Office of the Superintendent

Cell: 971-678-6103

Pronouns: he/him/his

communications.subject: RE: Oregon Public Records Law Request #PRR 2324-274
communications.communication:
Hi Ryan,

Thanks for your help with this and sorry for being unclear.

Ideally, I'm seeking the data for every school at the grade level. My understanding is that it can all be gathered by a district administrator account without necessitating every school/classroom to generate a seperate report, but if that's not the case please let me know. I'm happy to talk about ways to tailor the request so it's easier to complete.

Best,
Todd

communications.subject: Re: Oregon Public Records Law Request #PRR 2324-275
communications.communication:
Todd:

First, I realize I gave you the incorrect reference number, please use "PRR
2324-275" as needed.

Second, thanks for clarifying. I've revised your request as follows, for
clarity:


1) data [by grade level, by school] showing the amount of time students
spent on lessons in the IReady system for the year to date.
- This data can be accessed through the IReady system's lesson time-on-task
feature. An example of the lesson time-on-task report from another district
can be seen here:
https://www.detroitk12.org/cms/lib/MI50000060/Centricity/Domain/5951/IREADY%20Reading%20Time%20of%20Task%20022822.pdf
2) data [by grade level, by school] showing the amount of time students
spent playing learning games in the IReady system for the year to date.
- This data can be accessed through the IReady system's "Playtime" report.
A guide to accessing the Playtime report can be found here (page 15):
https://resources.finalsite.net/images/v1701973094/myvolusiaschoolsorg/xjqbs2fxosdtve0tlhi3/iready-educator-guide-learning-games-2-1.pdf


I'll find out from staff how much time we would need to compile this and
follow up ASAP.



*Thank you kindly,*

Ryan Vandehey

Public Records Officer & Media Relations Representative

Portland Public Schools
Communications Department | Office of the Superintendent

Cell: 971-678-6103

Pronouns: he/him/his

communications.subject: Re: Oregon Public Records Law Request #PRR 2324-275
communications.communication:
Hello:


The work required to process your request will require PPS to assess fees
for the time and cost. A written cost estimate is attached detailing those
fees.



To reduce fees, you may narrow the scope of your request. Please contact us
if you are interested in discussing options.



You may also request a waiver or reduction of fees. Once we receive that
request, we will make a decision within fifteen business days. Please
include any information you believe demonstrates that the request primarily
benefits the general public. If your request is denied, you have the right
to petition the District Attorney for review of that decision.



Per PPS policy and ORS 192.329(3)(a), work on this request will stop until
payment is received. Payment may be submitted to the Accounts Receivable
Desk. Credit card payments may be made online at the link below:



PPS Accounts Receivable:

501 North Dixon St, Portland, OR 97227

503-916-3005

accountsreceivable@pps.net

https://www.schoolpay.com/pay/for/Public-Records-Request--Legal-Only/Sc4woeM






*Thank you kindly,*

Ryan Vandehey

Public Records Officer & Media Relations Representative

Portland Public Schools
Communications Department | Office of the Superintendent

Cell: 971-678-6103

Pronouns: he/him/his

Best,
Todd

communications.subject: Re: Oregon Public Records Law Request #PRR 2324-275
communications.communication:
Hi, Todd:

My understanding is that you're seeking two separate reports for each of

Hi, Todd:

Quick update. We've had discussions with the vendor and I've had a chance
to actually see the software interface. Unfortunately, the "playtime
report" is just the data that's available within the i-ready system;
there's no option  within the software to export that data, nor do we have
aggregate data by school or district, just a YTD total of playtime minutes
for each class at each school. Putting that data into a shareable format
would involve manually tabulating data for each school. As per our
original estimates this would be many many hours of staff time.

Now that I better understand the software, I also took another look at the
sample you'd provided from Warwick(?) schools; I see that they have some
data access included in their contract. I will find out if our contract
provides for the same, and we will reach out again to the vendor to see if
they have the ability to provide similar data for us. I'll let you know if
that pans out, and then you can decide how to proceed.

title: Roger E. Guarino child molestion lawsuit

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Roger E. Guarino child molestion lawsuit
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request records related to child sexual abuse lawsuit against Roger E. Guarino (DoB: 9/14/1967), the Sodexo operations manager assigned to MCC until February 2022.

## Specific records

I am seeking the following specific records:
1.) Any communications with Sodexo regarding the lawsuit or Roger Guarino's status at MCC or the MCC Association.
2.) Any communications between MCC, the MCC Association, or  Roger Guarino regarding the lawsuit or any steps taken by MCC or the MCC Association in response to the lawsuit.
3.) Any communications with any other educational institution regarding Roger Guarino, including any communications with the University of Arkansas - Little Rock, where Sodexo reassigned Roger Guarino to another position that involved interacting with children despite being aware of the child molestation lawsuit.

## Applicability of FOIL to the  MCC Association, Inc 

I contend that records maintained MCC Association, Inc, a non-profit associated MCC, are within the scope of the New York Freedom of Information Law. Such records constitute "material received by a corporation providing services for a State university and kept on behalf of the university" (Encore Coll v. Auxiliary Serv NY Court of Appeals (1995) 87 N.Y.2d 410,414) and are thus "a record subject to disclosure under FOIL" (id.).

## Fees

In the event that there are fees in excess of $200, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Edward

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Roger E. Guarino child molestion lawsuit

Dear Edward.

We are in receipt of your Freedom of Information Law request dated June 7, 2024.  A response will be provided to you no later than Thursday, July 11, 2024.

Sincerely.

Virginia Geer-Mentry
MCC Association, Inc.

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: GA Tech APF
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any record sent or received between January 18, 2023, and the present by President Cabrera containing the terms "Atlanta Police Foundation" "APF" "Public Safety Training Center" "Cop City" or "Stop Cop City".  

If a responsive record takes the form of an email outlook calendar entry, or task, we would accept the following metadata for the email in .odt or .csv format: “to” “from” “cc” “bcc” “subject” “attachment title” “attachment size” “sent date/time” “received date/time” “message importance” “message flag” and “file size”. 

If a responsive record resides in a SharePoint or OneDrive file, we would accept a .csv containing a description of the file name, file type, and file size in lieu of producing the file itself. 

Thank you.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Police Chief Employment - Memphis
communications.communication:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am seeking official documentation related to the employment history of the persons listed below:

Cerelyn	Davis
James M. Ryall
Michael	Rallings
Toney	Armstrong
Larry	Godwin
James	Bolen
Walter	Crews
Bill	Oldham
Walter	Winfrey
Melvin	Burgess
James	Ivy

Specifically, I request the formal offer letter or employment agreement issued upon their commencement of the position. I am also interested in official documents regarding their departure, such as a resignation letter or termination notice.

Please provide the relevant documents, which specify their start and end dates (both as MM/DD/YYYY), and any other pertinent details relating to the type of separation and if they were internal/external to the Department.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with John Navarro.

James Bolen 
Walter Crews 
Bill Oldham 
Walter Winfrey

Specifically, I request the formal offer letter or employment agreement issued upon their commencement of the position. I am also interested in official documents regarding their departure, such as a resignation letter or termination notice. 

Please provide the relevant documents, which specify their start and end dates (both as MM/DD/YYYY), and any other pertinent details relating to the type of separation and if they were internal/external to the Department.

Sincerely, 

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with John Navarro”

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Meliora Report
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All writings received from Meliora Public Safety Consulting LLC as described in Meliora Jan 31, 2023 "Proposal For Organizational Assessment & Data Analysis" or similar reports as contracted with Marin County Sheriff’s Office. For clarity this contract was approved by the Board of Supervisors on April 25, 2023 and described in the accompanying Staff Report of that same date.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Frank Shinneman

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: FOIA Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide all FOIA requests sent to McLennan County and all entities under the McLennan County umbrella and all departments in the McLennan County System from January 1st 2024 to 06/17/2024. We do not need any responsive document just the original request and any communications related to that request, we do not need the actual responsive documents.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bernadette Feazell

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide all FOIA requests sent to McLennan County and all entities under the McLennan County umbrella and all departments in the McLennan County System from January 1st 2024 to 06/17/2024. We do not need any responsive document just the original request and any communications related to that request, we do not need the actual responsive documents.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bernadette Feazell

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
June 21, 2024 Re:       Public Information Cost Estimate Letter Dear Ms. Feazell: We have received your request for information dated: 06/20/2024. We have determined that complying with your request will result in the imposition of a charge that exceeds $40. Therefore, we are providing you with this cost estimate as required by section 552.2615 of the Texas Government Code. Itemized List of Charges: Description                              Qty x Price                  Total Labor minutes ($15/hour)      2610 x $0.25               $652.50 Overhead charges                   20% of $652.50           $130.50 Total cost       $783.00 There is a less expensive way for you to obtain this information. You may cut down on the requested timeframe to help narrow down the results of the request. Your request will be considered automatically withdrawn if you do not notify us in writing within ten business days from the date of this letter that you either: (a) accept the charges; (b) wish to modify your request; OR (c) have sent to the Open Records Division of the Office of the Attorney General a complaint alleging that you are being overcharged for the information you have requested. Sincerely, Lisa Foster Asst. Records Supervisor McLennan County Sheriff’s Office 901 Washington Ave. Waco, Texas 76701 P: 254-757-5108; F: 254-757-5091

-B

communications.subject: Sheriff's Office Records Request :: R001795-062124
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Our original estimate was based off the fact that a search of our system indicates that we received approximately 1,750 requests in the specified time frame of 01/01/2024 to 06/17/2024, and we believed we would need approximately 1.5 minutes to manually pull each one. Once contacted, the company providing our open records management system indicated that we can run a report that displays basic information on the requests submitted, including: reference number, create date, request status, customer name, and basic description of public record desired. 
According to that company, there . To capture the communications information, the requests will need to be exported one at a time. is no way to run a report that shows all correspondence or communications related to the requests 
Additionally, approximately 163 of these 1,750 requests were filled out manually, in-person at our front desk. These handwritten requests were scanned into the online system. Like the communications information, these handwritten requests will need to be exported one at a time. 
You can reduce the estimated time and cost to complete your request by withdrawing the portion of your request that was asking for communications related to each request, thereby reducing the need to export each request one at a time. Keep in mind, even if you withdraw the communications portion of your request, the handwritten requests described above will still need to be exported one at a time. The cost estimate for that is option is listed below. 
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
163 requests x 1.5 min processing time = 244.5 min (4.08 hours) 
LABOR 
4.08 hours x $15/hr = $61.13 
OVERHEAD 
$61.13 x 20% = $12.23 
TOTAL 
$61.13 + $12.23 = $ 73.36 
Sincerely, 
Lisa Foster 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Open Records Request Portal (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXf-2BjtJqt2dHoqDdFRIHkBPHGWMOA4-2BxvG16RM1bx2PEQ88xYavF7SDw7vGsjj2Aw456tooE9-2BjQu-2FIWhdjT61bAgFbv7gOEFpVTxeQ-2FKoejxwKd3_qyIcOwuygsI0WqwjM028jb5Y9LgrC-2Fel3HsXl5voGGSmUK36IQWS0Thguh8aRfv-2FhJ0PBbFQZuz9382wAHtFd161neXwDsWwGGNcVnPnV-2BV1VpnXcxn2KWpfN-2FtRT1MFT9LiTDr08lMN4jqfqp-2BcYUcF-2Bv2anI-2B75A0cieXrQXbQ8REr5O-2Bnv2c0qKbeNLTSEHaKyvRSgs4wgC80TL3heVCu3pH8ZfGg4cSqf-2ByRiJe-2FSx0eVwN0hQs2bdE9HSmlThFHt1t5tum6Kul3yj-2F6cT46dRm8-2Fo-2Flw3STV5e2k1uEs1xmnq6CVMflGpDLLZDOoLEqkRqTaKaRyKbX9xIwbsEc0jd9tl78F2GTw48tyDW49yiuot3DeDBe9l539P-2B5GTfupZYp5boEUSwbrrfBDg-3D-3D)

communications.subject: City of Aberdeen, MD Response to MPIA Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

The City of Aberdeen, via the Aberdeen Police Department, received your email dated June 26, 2024, making a request under the Maryland Public Information Act. You specifically requested:"...records for every sworn officer and civilian member of the Aberdeen Police Department for fiscal year 2023 and fiscal year 2024: 1. First and last name; 2. Unique sequence number; 3. Race; 4. Gender; 5. Hire date; 6. 2023 salary; 7. 2023 overtime; 8. 2024 salary; 9. 2024 overtime." Attached are the records responsive to your request.

Pursuant to General Provisions Article §4-362 you may seek judicial review of a decision to deny access to any public record. Additionally, pursuant to General Provisions Article §4-1B-04 you may seek the assistance of the Public Access
Ombudsman.
Regards,


Monica Correll, MMC
City Clerk
City of Aberdeen
60 North Parke Street
Aberdeen, MD 21001
Office:  410-272-1600, ext. 211

mcorrell@aberdeenmd.gov

communications.communication:
I serve as County attorney for Garrett County, Maryland and I am responding
to the Public Information Act (the "Act") request that you filed on June
26, 2024. In accordance with the provisions of the Act, I have attached all
information responsive to your request. We have not withheld  or denied
access to any public records resonsice to your request.

Despite having complied with the terms of the Act and your request, we
would advise you that you have the right to seek review of this
production by filing a Petition for Judicial Review with the Circuit Court
for Garrett County, Maryland


Gorman E. Getty III
Gorman E. Getty III, PA
Post Office Box 1485
23 Washington Street
Cumberland, MD 21501-1485
ggetty@ggettylaw.com
(301) 777-8032

 The information contained in this email message is protected under the
Electronic Communications Privacy Act, 18 U.S.C. 2310-2321, and may also be
protected by attorney-client and/or the attorney/work product privileges.
It is intended only for the use of the individual named above and the
privileges are not waived by virtue of this having been sent by email. If
the person receiving this email or any other reader of the email is not the
named recipient, any use, dissemination, distribution, or copying of the

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Agency Roster (Pinal County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Cost of Mural
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request the vendor fee, vendor contract, to include any and all costs associated with the new painted mural in the Barnstable County Jail.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Daralyn Heywood

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Police data collection (2017-2022) (Gilroy Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. the total number of use of force incidents reported from 2017-2022, separated by year.

2. the total number of use of force incidents, separated by type of force and year, from 2017-2022 (for example, information that specifies the number of taser incidents in 2022, baton incidents in 2022, taser incidents in 2021, baton incidents in 2021, etc.)

3. the total number of civilian complaints against law enforcement that were reported and the total number sustained from 2017-2022, separated by year.

4. the total number of civilian complaints alleging law enforcement use of excessive force that were reported and the total number sustained from 2017-2022, separated by year.

5. the total number of civilian complaints alleging biased policing or racial profiling that were reported and the total number sustained from 2017-2022, separated by year.

6. the total number of civilian complaints alleging criminal conduct that were reported and the total number sustained from 2017-2022, separated by year.

7. the total number of officer-involved shootings from 2017-2022, both fatal and non-fatal, separated by year.

8. the total number of people who police used force against in 2022, broken down by race/ethnicity.

When available, I would appreciate being sent individualized data in this request in spreadsheet format. If individualized data are unavailable, please send information that includes aggregate statistics for the item instead.

Note that my requests for civilian complaints are specifically for civilian complaints, please do not include complaints filed by one officer/the department against another officer.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.subject: Acknowledgment of Public Records Request of May 28, 2024, Reference #PRA-2024-00185
communications.communication:
Dear MuckRock   News, 
The City of Gilroy, City Clerk’s Office received the below records request from you on May 28, 2024 for records pursuant to the California Public Records Act, Government Code section 6250 et seq. (“PRA”) and the Gilroy Open Government Ordinance (“OGO”). 
 "Subject: California Public Records Act Request: Police data collection (2017-2022) (Gilroy Police Department)
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:
1. the total number of use of force incidents reported from 2017-2022, separated by year.
2. the total number of use of force incidents, separated by type of force and year, from 2017-2022 (for example, information that specifies the number of taser incidents in 2022, baton incidents in 2022, taser incidents in 2021, baton incidents in 2021, etc.)
3. the total number of civilian complaints against law enforcement that were reported and the total number sustained from 2017-2022, separated by year.
4. the total number of civilian complaints alleging law enforcement use of excessive force that were reported and the total number sustained from 2017-2022, separated by year.

title: Starship delivery robot reports (University Of Nevada Police)

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Starship delivery robot reports (University Of Nevada Police)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Public reports show that the robotic delivery company Starship is operating at your university: https://www.starship.xyz/starship-food-delivery-app/

Therefore, I hereby request the following records:

1) All presentations and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other information presented to the UNR Dining Marketing Coordinator Heidi Rich/University Police Department about Starship/Starship robots.

2) Any agreements/contracts between University of Nevada, Reno and other members of the University about or mentioning Starship delivery robots, including attachments and media. 

3) Any complaints or incident reports received about Starship through UNR PD

4) Any video footage or audio given to the university or university police department by Starship

Please search between August 1, 2021 and the time this request is processed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brooke Germain

communications.subject: RE: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Starship delivery robot reports (University Of Nevada Police)
communications.communication:

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Starship delivery robot reports (University Of Nevada Police)
communications.communication:
Hello Jodi,

I appreciate you sending over this document, but I do not find the document fully responsive to my request. It partially fulfills item #3 on the list, however, items #1, #2, and #4 remain unanswered/denied.  If I cannot obtain these contracts, footage, or complaints through your organization please let me know, as per NRS 239.0107(1). If this is the case, I would also appreciate direction to the correct agency. 

Otherwise, I believe the NPRA law requires agencies to provide reasoning for the denial of public records (NRS 239.0107(d)).

I recognize fulfilling the totality of my original request would result in the search for a large number of documents, so if it helps, the purpose of my request is to understand the relationship between UNR and Starship through their contracts and agreements, as well as marketing plans. I also want to understand the relationship between UNR students and Starship through incident reports and video footage.  If you find that you do have the records that I am looking for, and need more time to gather them, please provide me with a date that they will be ready by. 

Thank you for your help, and let me know if you need me to provide more clarification. 

My best,
Brooke Germain

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police staff roster (May 31 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster for May 31 2024 including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: OpenDocument spreadsheet, plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Police :: P184580-060324
communications.communication:
At this time, the Seattle Police Department’s Legal Unit is operating under a backlog of over 2, 000 open requests. We deeply appreciate your understanding and patience as we work diligently to respond to all pending requests. 
 
 
Dear Rose Terse: 
 
Thank you for using the Seattle Police Public Records Request Center. 
 
Your request was received on June 03, 2024and the reference number is P184580-060324. 
 
If the City's representative entered your request into the system and you didn't specifically register: 
 
  * Access the Police Public Records Request Center
  * Access the "My Records Request Center" 
  * Access the "View My Requests" 
  * Enter the E-Mail below (should be the E-Mail you gave the representative) 
  * At the login prompt click the forgotten password link

To download your records, please:

  * You can download records individually or all at the same time by clicking 'Download All'. 
  *  Please save your records as you may only download them from the system three times. If you do not download your records within 30 days of request closure, the link to your records will expire. 
If you believe you have received privileged or confidential records in error, please notify the City of Seattle immediately, through the Public Records Request Center or by email. Privileged or confidential records provided or received in error should not be reviewed, used, disseminated, distributed, or copied, and should be destroyed immediately. Thank you in advance for your cooperation. 
If you wish to appeal the search, production, or application of any exemption in connection with this request you may submit an appeal in writing to the Seattle Police Legal Unit within ten (10) business days from the date you received your records. 
Please include your name and address, a copy of any redacted files, and a copy of this letter together with a brief statement identifying the basis of the appeal.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Diplomatic Intercepts - Peru
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of FBI file 65-HQ-44391, on the interception of diplomatic communications from the Peruvian government during World War II.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1471626-000
communications.communication:
Good morning,

Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 104 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 853 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,786 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,500 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

title: Request for Your Agency's 2023-2024 Roster & Salary Data (Calvert County Sheriff's Department, Prince Frederick)

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Request for Your Agency's 2023-2024 Roster & Salary Data (Calvert County Sheriff's Department, Prince Frederick)
RE: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Request for Your Agency's 2023-2024 Roster & Salary Data (Calvert County Sheriff's Department, Prince Frederick)
communications.communication:
Good morning Ms. Levi,
I have forwarded your request to our Fiscal Manager, Mrs. Laura Kent.  She will be the point of contact for your request and has been cc’d on this e-mail.
v/r

Captain
W. Brent Parrott
Commander
Northwestern SPSC #374
Calvert County Sheriff’s Office
410-535-1600 Ext. 2584

Good afternoon,

I have attached the two reports as filtered down in our new county software (Workday).  Some of the information requested is not available in a report.  However, I have attached as much as is possible at this time.  Additionally, please find our response to your Public Information Request. Identifying factors (Names) have been redacted in accordance with §4-501 of the General Provisions Article of the Annotated Code of Maryland. The list requested by you, albeit a public record, is also a "personal record" pursuant to Section 4-501 of the General Provisions Article of the Annotated Code of Maryland because it names the employee. While the PIA makes it clear that the salary of a public employee is subject to disclosure, Section 4-401 of the General Provisions Article makes it unlawful for an employee of a governmental unit to willfully and knowingly allow inspection or use of a public record that names or, with reasonable certainty, otherwise identifies the individual by an identifying factor. Amongst other things, Section 4-501(c)(3)(iv) & (v) of the General Provisions Article states that the Custodian must disclose to persons of interest/employees: 1) whether the personal information is generally available for public inspection and 2) whether the personal information collected is made available, transferred or shared with any other entity other than the Custodian.   
 
It could also be argued that this is a part of the employee's personnel record. [But for the exemption of the salary of a public employee], Section 4-311 prohibits inspection of an employee's personnel record except by the employee, an elected or appointed official who supervises the employee's work or an employee organization described in Title 6 of the Education Article of the Annotated Code of Maryland, none of which are applicable in this case.
 
It is our practice to disclose job titles and salaries only per the above listed provisions of the Annotated Code of Maryland.

communications.subject: Ref NPR2024-0063531
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,

This correspondence is in response to your LVMPD Public Records Request NPR2024-0063531.  You were requesting the following:

1. Any policy concerning press or media credentials (that is, who is eligible for applying for a press credential, the standards applied to applications, or what access or privileges are granted by a press credential).

2. A copy of any media distribution list currently used by the Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department, including any email or mailing list.

In response to Item #1 – LVMPD is not the custodian of the Nevada Revised Statutes.  However, a link to them is here NRS Search (state.nv.us)<http://search.leg.state.nv.us/NRS/NRS.html>.  To the extent your request seeks a legal opinion, that would be privileged.  NRS 49.185; Cotter v. Eighth Judicial Dist. Court of Nev., --- Nev. ---, 416 P.3d 228 (2018).  In any case, no specific records exist other than the policies provided here.

In response to Item #2 – Please see attached for the most current media email list.

Sincerely,

Public Records Unit
Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department

title: Department of Defense support for unknown entertainment project "Breaking the Silence"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Department of Defense support for unknown entertainment project "Breaking the Silence"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to collaboration between the Department of Defense (DoD) and the production of "Breaking the Silence," a title which appears on an attached list, released to me through FOIA by DoD, of TV and movie productions supported by DoD in 2023. I request any and all documents pertaining to DoD involvement with the production of "Breaking the Silence." Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of DoD and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Breaking the Silence," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Hate Crime Data (2010-2020) (Anaheim Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Information on all hate crimes occuring in the city of jurisdiction from January 1, 2010 to December 31, 2020. The information should include (although not be restricted to) the following: date-of-occurrence (YYYY-MM-DD), time-of-occurrence (HH:MM),  description of crime committed, location information at the finest geographic level available (street address or block),  beat, district, weapon used, bias motivation (e.g., Anti-Black/Anti-Gay/Anti-Transgender), number of suspect(s),  number of victim(s), injuries incurred, suspect(s) race, victim(s) race,  victim(s) sex, suspect(s) sex,, victim(s) age, suspect(s) age. 

Please provide me with these public records in a machine-readable ASCII format, such as a CSV, SQL, TXT, or similar raw file. CSV or SQL files are preferred when available. Please email the responsive records to my email address: michaeltopper@ucsb.edu.

If email transmission is not feasible, I agree to prepay the actual cost of the storage medium on which the responsive records are transmitted, any postage costs incurred. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael Topper

title: Gilbert Police Department, Gilbert, AZ Request

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Gilbert Police Department, Gilbert, AZ Request
communications.communication:
To Whom it may concern,
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:
Any and all records from the past year regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as ordinance in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as Abatement of Public Nuisances as described in Chapter 42, Article VIII of the city code.
Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to:
• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request.
Sincerely,
Jenny Wadhwa

communications.subject: RE: Arizona Public Records Law Request #GPDR2024-7454
communications.communication:
Hello,
Sorry for the miscommunication. Can you please send police calls, reports, citations, or arrests from the past calendar year (4/1/2023 through 4/1/2024) for the purpose of enforcing the Crime-Free “Lite” Program, as referenced here: https://www.gilbertaz.gov/departments/police/crime-prevention ? 

Kindly,
Jenny

communications.subject: Gilbert Police Department - Public Record Request
communications.communication:
Hello, 
 The Crime-Free “Lite” Program is a program that provides property owners a list of Calls for Service that have been dispatched to the address of the business or rental property that they own. 
 This program is not something that is "enforced", and is merely a tool for property owners to stay aware of what is occurring at the address that they are monitoring. 
 I may be misinterpreting what you are saying here: "Can you please send police calls, reports, citations, or arrests from the past calendar year (4/1/2023 through 4/1/2024) for the purpose of enforcing the Crime-Free “Lite” Program"

Please let me know if that is the case! 
 Zak Whitfield 
 PD Records Supervisor 
 Gilbert Police Records 
 75 E Civic Center Dr. 
 Gilbert AZ, 85296 
 (480)635-7020

communications.subject: RE: Arizona Public Records Law Request #GPDR2024-7454
communications.communication: Yes, that is the case. Thank you for clarifying.

On May 3, 2024:
Subject: Gilbert Police Department - Public Record Request
Hello,
The Crime-Free “Lite” Program is a program that provides property owners a list of Calls for Service that have been dispatched to the address of the business or rental property that they own.
This program is not something that is "enforced", and is merely a tool for property owners to stay aware of what is occurring at the address that they are monitoring.
I may be misinterpreting what you are saying here: "Can you please send police calls, reports, citations, or arrests from the past calendar year (4/1/2023 through 4/1/2024) for the purpose of enforcing the Crime-Free “Lite” Program"

Please let me know if that is the case!
Zak Whitfield
PD Records Supervisor
Gilbert Police Records
75 E Civic Center Dr.
Gilbert AZ, 85296
(480)635-7020
---

 Various factors also affect processing time, including the size and complexity of the request, nature of the records sought, and parameters provided. The records provided to you will be based off the specific search parameters and keywords defined in your records request. 
  
 You can check the check the status of your request or access your documents by clicking on the reference number link below. Remember to check your spam filter or junk mail folder for any email correspondence from the Town.

 Security key is 411531. 
  
 For questions regarding requests, please email to the below:

 EMS Records (Patient Care Reports and Billing) and Fire Reports (Incident and/or Inspection) = GFDRecordsRequest@gilbertaz.gov.

 Town Of Gilbert

On April 10, 2024:
Subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Gilbert Police Department, Gilbert, AZ Request
To Whom it may concern,
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:
Any and all records from the past year regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as ordinance in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as Abatement of Public Nuisances as described in Chapter 42, Article VIII of the city code.
Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to:
• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request.
Sincerely,
Jenny Wadhwa

 On May 3, 2024:
Subject: Gilbert Police Department - Public Record Request
Hello,
The Crime-Free “Lite” Program is a program that provides property owners a list of Calls for Service that have been dispatched to the address of the business or rental property that they own.
This program is not something that is "enforced", and is merely a tool for property owners to stay aware of what is occurring at the address that they are monitoring.
I may be misinterpreting what you are saying here: "Can you please send police calls, reports, citations, or arrests from the past calendar year (4/1/2023 through 4/1/2024) for the purpose of enforcing the Crime-Free “Lite” Program" 
  
 Please let me know if that is the case!
Zak Whitfield
PD Records Supervisor
Gilbert Police Records
75 E Civic Center Dr.
Gilbert AZ, 85296
(480)635-7020
---

Subject: Town of Gilbert - Records Request Confirmation- GPDR2024-7454
*Note: This is an automated email notification. Please do not respond to this email.

Thank you for submitting a records request to the Town of Gilbert.

We strive to complete routine requests as promptly as possible, but keep in mind that the Town of Gilbert is closed on Fridays and most government holidays.

Various factors also affect processing time, including the size and complexity of the request, nature of the records sought, and parameters provided. The records provided to you will be based off the specific search parameters and keywords defined in your records request.

You can check the check the status of your request or access your documents by clicking on the reference number link below. Remember to check your spam filter or junk mail folder for any email correspondence from the Town.

Reference number is Request Number: GPDR2024-7454.

Security key is 411531.

For questions regarding requests, please email to the below:

Public, Build (Eplan) and GIS = ClerksOffice@gilbertaz.gov.

Police Records = gilbertpdrecords@gilbertaz.gov.

EMS Records (Patient Care Reports and Billing) and Fire Reports (Incident and/or Inspection) = GFDRecordsRequest@gilbertaz.gov.

You must provide your security key and reference number when inquiring about your records request.

Thank you,

Town Of Gilbert
50 East Civic Center Drive | Gilbert, AZ 85296
Mon-Thurs, 7:00am - 6:00pm; Closed Fridays

 On April 10, 2024:
Subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Gilbert Police Department, Gilbert, AZ Request
To Whom it may concern,
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:
Any and all records from the past year regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as ordinance in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as Abatement of Public Nuisances as described in Chapter 42, Article VIII of the city code.
Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to:
• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
